item.title: testing out openDNS
item.description: I just put openDNS into place at skinny. It is a neat DNS “replacement” that is a bit more intelligent than regular DNS. it apparently checks for phishing and notifies the user that they are going to a “phishing site.” This is pretty cool stuff - however i am worried about who chooses the phishing sites. I mean, what if they become a bit more vigilant and start blocking “hacking sites” or “sites deemed inappropriate?
